pros: •Friendly People in All Departments •Remote work available •Decent Pay/Salary •Pleasant Coworkers •Good IT department •Free life insurance benefits up to 50k •Feels like they have money (compared to a lot of other places I worked) •Reimbursement available for many personally purchased items (depends on department you work in)
cons: •Lots of things to do upon hire: including must be COVID vaccinated (1+ Hr Long Appointment with employee health, that includes a physical/eye/hearing test, & drug test which includes recreational marijuana & I believe if you fail for this- they revoke your job offer, Bloodwork (Who else Hates needles?!?), Immunizations must be up to date or else they will immunize)! •Benefits are expensive & not that great

pros: Management is attentive and cares about employees. Benefits are good, pay is in line with industry standards (for office).
cons: I have no cons to share.

pros: The hospital is like a family. Friendly co workers. Short commute

pros: Some good people, good community
cons: Extremely political. Vacation time has to be used for all holidays. And anything over 5 days a year sick time is a write up even if its excused.

review_title: Poor hospital management, but great coworkers, clinical collaboration, and team.
pros: Great therapists especially in kids program.
cons: Significant understaffing and competent support staff, due to poor management and major budget/deficit issues... this effects patient care and turn over with Dr's and therapists leaving. No electronic system. Ancient, time consuming, ineffective record system, with no quality assurance staff, and inaccurate/inefficient data tracking/scheduling database.

pros: Smaller community hospital with a family feel. The hospital is going through tough times now due to funding and budget cuts. Overall a good place to work.
cons: High deductible insurance plan for employees, minimal holiday paid days off. Poor parking conditions. ( Not enough spaces.)

review_title: Great team doing excellent work in a caring community environment
pros:
Family-like feel to the staff
Cooperative environment
Competitive benefits
Pride of employment - this is a small community hospital doing big things to provide high quality care in its local community despite the many challenges facing healthcare today
cons: Compensation doesn't always equal what's provided at large hospitals/health systems, but the benefits and the work environment make up for it.

pros: At the time, friendly family oriented facility.  I was for 36  yrs. And saw many changes.  Retired early to move south.
cons: Has been merged with a larger facility.  The CEO and CIO whom I worked with are both gone now.

review_title: Management gets rid of all senior employees after training replacements . Top of scales means out of job
pros: co-workers great and great physicians.
cons: raise freezes, no holiday bonuses,poor starting rates, BAD insurance, most of all, management is overpaid and under qualified.

pros: No traffic, easy commute. Employee parking is close to entrances. People are generally very nice and friendly.  Good vacation time.
cons: Need to get rid of old school mentality and empower their employees. No real trainings offered to employees or management.

pros: The staff at Day Kimball are friendly, courteous and compassionate.  They encourage advancement throughout the facility. Truly an enjoyable place to work.
cons: Only negative, limited parking spaces
